ARABIC: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا بَلَغَ بَيْنَ ٱلسَّدَّيْنِ وَجَدَ مِن دُونِهِمَا قَوْمًا لَّا يَكَادُونَ يَفْقَهُونَ قَوْلًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: until he arrived between the two mountains where he found a people scarcely able to understand speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Till he reached a place between two mountains, and found this side of it a people who understood but little of what was spoken.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: until when he reached a place between the two mountains, he found beside the mountains a people who scarcely understood anything.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: after this to the middle of two mountains where he found a people who could hardly understand a single word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Until, when he came between two mountains, he found before them a nation that did not appear to understand any speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Until, when he reached between two mountains, he found before them a people who scarcely understood a word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Until when he reached (a place) between the two mountains, he found on that side of them a people who could hardly understand a word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: until, when he reached between the two barriers, he found this side of them a people scarcely able to understand speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Till, when he came between the two mountains, he found upon their hither side a folk that scarce could understand a saying.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: until he came between two mountains. He found beside them a people who could scarcely understand a word [of his language].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Until when he arrived between the two mountains, he found beside them a people who well-nigh understood not a word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When he reached [the place] between the two barriers, he found between them a people who could hardly understand a word [of his language].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Until, when he reached (a tract) between two mountains, he found, beneath them, a people who scarcely understood a word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Until, when he reached between two mountains, he found, before (near) them (those two mountains), a people who scarcely understood a word.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: when he reached between the two barriers he found on one side of them a nation who could barely understand speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Until, when he reached the point separating the two barriers, he found beside them a people who could barely understand what is said.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:93] until, when he reached between the two barriers (read al-saddayn or al-suddayn here and [likewise] further below [at verse 94, saddan or suddan]) — [these were] two mountains [lying] in the remote regions beyond the land of the Turks; Alexander sealed the breach between the two, as will be described [below] — he found on this side of them, that is, in front of them, a folk that could scarcely comprehend speech, in other words, they could only understand it after much agonising (a variant reading [for yafqahūna, ‘comprehend’] has yufqihūna, ‘be understood’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Till, when he came between the two mountains, he found upon their hither side) between the two mountains (a folk that scarce could understand a saying) from other people.
